String.Source: All Vanilla NPCs set to 1 and odds set to 50%
String.Dest: All Vanilla NPCs set to 1 and odds set to 50%

String.Source: Welcome User! The entire Sands of Time team are glad to have you aboard, we are looking forward to drowning you now. The slower the death the more show for us! No, seriously we are glad you are trying out the mod. The mod is an overhaul for encounters and has very much to offer you. To help you out, if you are new to SoT, we recommend you read all the scrolls on the Help page to get a feel for all of the mod's features. Further, if you are new, we HIGHLY recommend you select a Preset to get you started. Each Guidance Scroll will give a brief summary over each different tab. The Special Topic scrolls will give details of very specific features. Once again, we are glad you are here for us to abuse. We hope you enjoy! Sincerely, The SoT Team
String.Dest: Welcome User! The entire Sands of Time team are glad to have you aboard, we are looking forward to drowning you now. The slower the death the more show for us! No, seriously we are glad you are trying out the mod. The mod is an overhaul for encounters and has very much to offer you. To help you out, if you are new to SoT, we recommend you read all the scrolls on the Help page to get a feel for all of the mod's features. Further, if you are new, we HIGHLY recommend you select a Preset to get you started. Each Guidance Scroll will give a brief summary over each different tab. The Special Topic scrolls will give details of very specific features. Once again, we are glad you are here for us to abuse. We hope you enjoy! Sincerely, The SoT Team

String.Source:
-The All Knowing- This screen gives a bird's eye view over everything that is happening currently with the mod. It also gives the option to quickly suspend (disable) a certain encounter type or system. There are many states in which an encounter can be in; they are as follow:
Active/Running - The encounter is currently processing - heads up!
Sleeping - The encounter type is active, but it is on cooldown (to save you from massive hordes)
Suspended - The feature is currently disabled
Every aspect of SoT can be tweaked or disabled according to your playstyle - you're welcome.
String.Dest:
-The All Knowing- This screen gives a bird's eye view over everything that is happening currently with the mod. It also gives the option to quickly suspend (disable) a certain encounter type or system. There are many states in which an encounter can be in; they are as follow:
Active/Running - The encounter is currently processing - heads up!
Sleeping - The encounter type is active, but it is on cooldown (to save you from massive hordes)
Suspended - The feature is currently disabled
Every aspect of SoT can be tweaked or disabled according to your playstyle - you're welcome.

String.Source:
-Selecting The Right Wuss Level-
We recommend for any new users of the mod to select a preset (probably Milk Drinker). The presets are not set-in-stone predefined rules, but rather building blocks to expand upon once you learn more about the mod's settings. Of course, a preset setting is not required, but they are there to make your life easier.
String.Dest:
-Selecting The Right Wuss Level-
We recommend for any new users of the mod to select a preset (probably Milk Drinker). The presets are not set-in-stone predefined rules, but rather building blocks to expand upon once you learn more about the mod's settings. Of course, a preset setting is not required, but they are there to make your life easier.

String.Source:
-Surface, It's What's Happening-
The Surface Encounters take place while 'above' ground when you are exploring the sites of Skyrim.
Surface Encounters will spawn vanilla creatures as well as unique creatures and scenarios, such as a group of skeletons or poverty stricken teenagers. The feature comes coupled with 'reinforcement' encounters that can spawn more enemies if a fight exceeds a certain amount of time. (Enemies may yell for help, or the sound of battle will get the attention from some hungry animals nearby).
String.Dest:
-Surface, It's What's Happening-
The Surface Encounters take place while 'above' ground when you are exploring the sites of Skyrim.
Surface Encounters will spawn vanilla creatures as well as unique creatures and scenarios, such as a group of skeletons or poverty stricken teenagers. The feature comes coupled with 'reinforcement' encounters that can spawn more enemies if a fight exceeds a certain amount of time. (Enemies may yell for help, or the sound of battle will get the attention from some hungry animals nearby).

String.Source:
-Divining The Scales-
SoT has a unique built in 'Enhancer' mechanic to ensure the player experiences epic battles of many enemies as opposed to just a few here and there.
This Enhancer rolls encounter types in ADDITION to what the vanilla game will spawn and what the SoT surface encounters will spawn. So the spawning systems will stack. This system uses the input ratio given and yields results accordingly. By Default, the ratio is 50/50. So, when SoT is going to generate an enhancer encounter, it will first check to see if it is allowed to offer unique NPCs (such as Death Knights), or if it is only allowed to offer Vanilla spawns (such as bandits and skeletons). If you want strictly hardcore SoT spawns, then suspend this system.
String.Dest:
-Divining The Scales-
SoT has a unique built in 'Enhancer' mechanic to ensure the player experiences epic battles of many enemies as opposed to just a few here and there.
This Enhancer rolls encounter types in ADDITION to what the vanilla game will spawn and what the SoT surface encounters will spawn. So the spawning systems will stack. This system uses the input ratio given and yields results accordingly. By Default, the ratio is 50/50. So, when SoT is going to generate an enhancer encounter, it will first check to see if it is allowed to offer unique NPCs (such as Death Knights), or if it is only allowed to offer Vanilla spawns (such as bandits and skeletons). If you want strictly hardcore SoT spawns, then suspend this system.

String.Source:
-As Above, So Below-
This particular element will generate more bad guys in all the deep dark places one would expect them - caves, dungeons, ruins, etc.
The Spirit Spawn system uses invisible spawn points that maneuver, at varying distances, with you as you explore. From these points will spawn enemies, sometimes behind you!
To further enhance the difficulty, 'reinforcements' can also be called on from the enemy if a battle exceeds a certain amount of time.
String.Dest:
-As Above, So Below-
This particular element will generate more bad guys in all the deep dark places one would expect them - caves, dungeons, ruins, etc.
The Spirit Spawn system uses invisible spawn points that maneuver, at varying distances, with you as you explore. From these points will spawn enemies, sometimes behind you!
To further enhance the difficulty, 'reinforcements' can also be called on from the enemy if a battle exceeds a certain amount of time.

String.Source:
-A Curse is the Worst-
The apocalypse when enabled will permit the cursed Rumiirua to walk the land. They appear in all major holds and will continue to devour the flesh of it's inhabitants until a warrior brave enough comes to their aid.
A lore friendly book that describes the Rumiirua will be found in game.
String.Dest:
-A Curse is the Worst-
The apocalypse when enabled will permit the cursed Rumiirua to walk the land. They appear in all major holds and will continue to devour the flesh of it's inhabitants until a warrior brave enough comes to their aid.
A lore friendly book that describes the Rumiirua will be found in game.

String.Source:
-Playing Nice With Assassins-
These special Agents of Mephala require one to keep a vigilant look out. They can disguise themselves as ANY NPC in the game - no matter how important, a lowly hunter, a town merchant even the hold's Jarl.
They will walk about without causing any suspicion since they have an uncanny resemblance to a nearby resident. However, once they feel the time is right, they will strike at the player without mercy and use the most deadly of poisons.
You have been warned!
String.Dest:
-Playing Nice With Assassins-
These special Agents of Mephala require one to keep a vigilant look out. They can disguise themselves as ANY NPC in the game - no matter how important, a lowly hunter, a town merchant even the hold's Jarl.
They will walk about without causing any suspicion since they have an uncanny resemblance to a nearby resident. However, once they feel the time is right, they will strike at the player without mercy and use the most deadly of poisons.
You have been warned!

String.Source:
-Everyday Nightmares-
This page has settings for features such as
Fast Travel Ambushes
Tomb or Shrine Desecration consequences
Ambushes while Sleeping
Merchants and Treasure Hunter
These 'lesser' encounters will still change your game, and in a big way.
String.Dest:
-Everyday Nightmares-
This page has settings for features such as
Fast Travel Ambushes
Tomb or Shrine Desecration consequences
Ambushes while Sleeping
Merchants and Treasure Hunter
These 'lesser' encounters will still change your game, and in a big way.

String.Source:
-Pompus Populus Pricks-
The Populated Spawns feature lets you enable/disable pre-placed NPCs to enhance overall difficulty. The spawns will instantly populate an area or vanish from it according to your settings. Further, these spawns are unique in that a few of them are 'trigger' spawns and upon death will trigger new spawns that were hiding to appear and help fight against the heroes that are trying to slay them.
These are SoT's own unique version of the many populated spawn mods available.
The Genesis Effect is an automated spawning system making nearly every encounter area populated with enemies.
String.Dest:
-Pompus Populus Pricks-
The Populated Spawns feature lets you enable/disable pre-placed NPCs to enhance overall difficulty. The spawns will instantly populate an area or vanish from it according to your settings. Further, these spawns are unique in that a few of them are 'trigger' spawns and upon death will trigger new spawns that were hiding to appear and help fight against the heroes that are trying to slay them.
These are SoT's own unique version of the many populated spawn mods available.
The Genesis Effect is an automated spawning system making nearly every encounter area populated with enemies.

String.Source:
-The More, the Merrier (sort of)-
This feature bolsters Vanilla spawns in the game--duh. So, for example if you are approaching a fort and the game is going to generate 4 bandits (how lame), SoT will bolster that 'army' by adding another 8 bandits, which is much better! The thing to remember is that the settings don't add a set number of bandits according to your input, but rather it clones each bandit by the number you tell it to. So, if you set 'Bandits' to 2, each bandit will be cloned twice. Cloning 4 bandits (in this example) twice will yield 8 more bandits added to the original 4 (a total of 12 for those that can't do math)
String.Dest:
-The More, the Merrier (sort of)-
This feature bolsters Vanilla spawns in the game--duh. So, for example if you are approaching a fort and the game is going to generate 4 bandits (how lame), SoT will bolster that 'army' by adding another 8 bandits, which is much better! The thing to remember is that the settings don't add a set number of bandits according to your input, but rather it clones each bandit by the number you tell it to. So, if you set 'Bandits' to 2, each bandit will be cloned twice. Cloning 4 bandits (in this example) twice will yield 8 more bandits added to the original 4 (a total of 12 for those that can't do math)

String.Source:
-Chilling Out Like A Boss-
Certain bosses are packed in and waiting to challenge the player. These bosses are not your typical higher level NPC. If you meet them, be prepared for a challenging and unique battle. Each boss can be enabled or disabled as well as have their chance of appearing limited. Using this screen will allow you to adjust all settings having to do with the various bosses that will humble you.
String.Dest:
-Chilling Out Like A Boss-
Certain bosses are packed in and waiting to challenge the player. These bosses are not your typical higher level NPC. If you meet them, be prepared for a challenging and unique battle. Each boss can be enabled or disabled as well as have their chance of appearing limited. Using this screen will allow you to adjust all settings having to do with the various bosses that will humble you.

String.Source:
-Maniacal Mechanics-
The System Settings tab will grant access to various universal and specific mod toggles as well as allow enabling the in depth debugging utilities.
String.Dest:
-Maniacal Mechanics-
The System Settings tab will grant access to various universal and specific mod toggles as well as allow enabling the in depth debugging utilities.

String.Source: Affects Reinforcements in dungeons. There are two modes: 1-constant- based on die rolls the enemy will be periodically reinforced all the time 2-tactical- for thieves, stealthy type. The reinforcements will only be sent for if you are hit X number of times. This is the stealth level in the mcm menu. You can set it to one, two, or three. That will be the number of times you can be hit before reinforcements are called for. If you kill the enemy before they arrive then reinforcements are cancelled. The 1 to 3 counter is considered to be 'cover'. When you lose cover you gain a point. When you recover cover you lose a point. Losing a point is good. You can recover a point by leaving the immediate cell to another cell. The whole point is to reward players for playing stealthy and to simulate penalties for being discovered. Then to simulate running into the shadows and retreating if discovered and regaining/retrying the stealthy approach. Works really well.
String.Dest: Affects Reinforcements in dungeons. There are two modes: 1-constant- based on die rolls the enemy will be periodically reinforced all the time 2-tactical- for thieves, stealthy type. The reinforcements will only be sent for if you are hit X number of times. This is the stealth level in the mcm menu. You can set it to one, two, or three. That will be the number of times you can be hit before reinforcements are called for. If you kill the enemy before they arrive then reinforcements are cancelled. The 1 to 3 counter is considered to be 'cover'. When you lose cover you gain a point. When you recover cover you lose a point. Losing a point is good. You can recover a point by leaving the immediate cell to another cell. The whole point is to reward players for playing stealthy and to simulate penalties for being discovered. Then to simulate running into the shadows and retreating if discovered and regaining/retrying the stealthy approach. Works really well.

String.Source: Some players find that the standard fast travel script does not work for them. This alternate script written by xilef11 has helped such users. Please keep in mind the following notes from xilef11 - The first fast travel after loading the game is less reliably detected for some reason, and this method has the drawback of having to wait at least 5 seconds after checking the map to enter a loading door, otherwise the script will think the player has fast traveled.
String.Dest: Some players find that the standard fast travel script does not work for them. This alternate script written by xilef11 has helped such users. Please keep in mind the following notes from xilef11 - The first fast travel after loading the game is less reliably detected for some reason, and this method has the drawback of having to wait at least 5 seconds after checking the map to enter a loading door, otherwise the script will think the player has fast traveled.

String.Source: There are two separate cooldown options for Walking Encounters. Thye are side by side, Base Cooldown and Cooldown. Max value for base cooldown is 40. For cooldown is 120. The cooldown value is a cool down period of no attack measured in minutes. A vaue of 5 means no attacks for 5 minutes minimum. Max 120 minutes. in contrast, base cool down is calculated at its value times the walking timer (normally 20). So a value of 5 equals 100 seconds, less than two minutes. The base cooldown is more useful if player changes the walking script (heartbeat) timer. Try to use just one and set the other to zero. Really I should delete one but it allows more fine tuning.
String.Dest: There are two separate cooldown options for Walking Encounters. Thye are side by side, Base Cooldown and Cooldown. Max value for base cooldown is 40. For cooldown is 120. The cooldown value is a cool down period of no attack measured in minutes. A vaue of 5 means no attacks for 5 minutes minimum. Max 120 minutes. in contrast, base cool down is calculated at its value times the walking timer (normally 20). So a value of 5 equals 100 seconds, less than two minutes. The base cooldown is more useful if player changes the walking script (heartbeat) timer. Try to use just one and set the other to zero. Really I should delete one but it allows more fine tuning.

String.Source: If Set to True Mod Will Use An Alternate Script to Detect Fast Travel. After Toggling Save Game and Reload Game. See Extended Help Scroll 2.
String.Dest: If Set to True Mod Will Use An Alternate Script to Detect Fast Travel. After Toggling Save Game and Reload Game. See Extended Help Scroll 2.

String.Source: If an NPC Dies and a Chest is Dropped the Dead NPC Is Normally Deleted Unless Toggled Here.
String.Dest: If an NPC Dies and a Chest is Dropped the Dead NPC Is Normally Deleted Unless Toggled Here.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Volunruud Tomb.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Volunruud Tomb.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Uttering Hills.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Uttering Hills.

String.Source: Allow Undead Patrol At Dustman Cairn.
String.Dest: Allow Undead Patrol At Dustman Cairn.

String.Source: Allow Increased Drops of Treasure Chests.
String.Dest: Allow Increased Drops of Treasure Chests.

String.Source: Odds of Treasure Chests Being Dropped.
String.Dest: Odds of Treasure Chests Being Dropped.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Silent Moons Camp Including A Patrol.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Silent Moons Camp Including A Patrol.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Movarth's Lair.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Movarth's Lair.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Knife Point Camp.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Knife Point Camp.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Dead Men's Respite.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Dead Men's Respite.

String.Source: Timing Value Measured From .1 to 1.0 Seconds, Default is .4 seconds. Divide MCM Menu Value by 10 to Obtain Real Value. If Set to Low, Fat Travel Will Not Be Detected. If Too High, Player Will See His Character Arrive At Fast Travel Destination Only To Be Yanked Away to Encounter.
String.Dest: Timing Value Measured From .1 to 1.0 Seconds, Default is .4 seconds. Divide MCM Menu Value by 10 to Obtain Real Value. If Set to Low, Fat Travel Will Not Be Detected. If Too High, Player Will See His Character Arrive At Fast Travel Destination Only To Be Yanked Away to Encounter.

String.Source: Enables or Disables Krull the Fletcher. The NPC is Placed In Riverwood by SOT.
String.Dest: Enables or Disables Krull the Fletcher. The NPC is Placed In Riverwood by SOT.

String.Source: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Added Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)
String.Dest: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Added Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)

String.Source: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Increased Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)
String.Dest: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Increased Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)

String.Source: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Waiting Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)
String.Dest: Adds a Cooldown to Dungeon Waiting Spawns. Calculated by Value Here Times the Dungeon Heartbeat Value (usually 12 seconds plus adjusters)

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Karthspire Camp. An open sprawling Forsworn encampment located Northwest of Old Hroldan Inn.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Karthspire Camp. An open sprawling Forsworn encampment located Northwest of Old Hroldan Inn.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Halted Stream. An iron mine and cavern overlain with a wooden fort located Northwest of Whitewatch Tower.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Halted Stream. An iron mine and cavern overlain with a wooden fort located Northwest of Whitewatch Tower.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Druadach Redoubt. A small encampment and cave occupied by Forsworn, located Southwest of Mor Khazgur and north of the Shrine to Peryite.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Druadach Redoubt. A small encampment and cave occupied by Forsworn, located Southwest of Mor Khazgur and north of the Shrine to Peryite.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Robbers Gorge.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Robbers Gorge.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of AngarVunde Crypt.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of AngarVunde Crypt.

String.Source: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Dragon BridgeOverlook, A small Forsworn camp on a cliff overlooking Dragon Bridge.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Will Increase the Population of Bandits at Dragon BridgeOverlook, A small Forsworn camp on a cliff overlooking Dragon Bridge.

String.Source: If Set to True, Mod Will Attempt to Remove from Player all Magical Effects. This Includes The Infamous Draugr Eyes Effect. Toggle to ON, Then Exit Menu and Wait 60 Seconds.
String.Dest: If Set to True, Mod Will Attempt to Remove from Player all Magical Effects. This Includes The Infamous Draugr Eyes Effect. Toggle to ON, Then Exit Menu and Wait 60 Seconds.

String.Source: Toggles Whether Player Can Be Attacked While Waiting Or Working In An Area. If True Then Player Can Only Be Attacked While Travelling Somewhere.
String.Dest: Toggles Whether Player Can Be Attacked While Waiting Or Working In An Area. If True Then Player Can Only Be Attacked While Travelling Somewhere.

String.Source: Extends the Distance That NPCs Are Spawned in Surface Encounters. Anything over 3,000 is the same as 6,000.
String.Dest: Extends the Distance That NPCs Are Spawned in Surface Encounters. Anything over 3,000 is the same as 6,000.

String.Source: Whether to Display Covert and Stealth Messages.
String.Dest: Whether to Display Covert and Stealth Messages.

String.Source: Quick Presets to Start Playing Right Away. Recommended is the Spartan setting. Select it again to enable it.
String.Dest: Quick Presets to Start Playing Right Away. Recommended is the Spartan setting. Select it again to enable it.

String.Source: Odds of Being Attacked if Stealing From Shrines.
String.Dest: Odds of Being Attacked if Stealing From Shrines.

String.Source: Select What Happens When Mephala Dagger is Looted. Whether Player Can Use It, Whether It Is Limited To Level 20 or Higher, or Whether it Breaks.

String.Source: Allow Player to Wear Unique SOT Armor Regardless of Player Level. Such as the Assassins Outfit.
String.Dest: Allow Player to Wear Unique SOT Armor Regardless of Player Level. Such as the Assassins Outfit.

String.Source: Disable or Enable the Wizard Braxton Stormcrow. Resides at College of Magic.
String.Dest: Disable or Enable the Wizard Braxton Stormcrow. Resides at College of Magic.

String.Source: Pause the Dungeon Encounters, both Added and Waiting. Only pauses encounters on Dungeon Encounters MCM page.
String.Dest: Pause the Dungeon Encounters, both Added and Waiting. Only pauses encounters on Dungeon Encounters MCM page.

String.Source: Whether to Allow NPCs From This Mod To Use Shouts.
String.Dest: Whether to Allow NPCs From This Mod To Use Shouts.

String.Source: Enable or Disable Fast Travel Ambushes.
String.Dest: Enable or Disable Fast Travel Ambushes.

String.Source: Maximum Number of Minutes Before Reinforcements Appear.
String.Dest: Maximum Number of Minutes Before Reinforcements Appear.

String.Source: Minimum Number of Minutes Before Reinforcements Appear.
String.Dest: Minimum Number of Minutes Before Reinforcements Appear.

String.Source: Chance of Gypsy Merchant Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.
String.Dest: Chance of Gypsy Merchant Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.

String.Source: Chance of Arms Dealer Merchant Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.
String.Dest: Chance of Arms Dealer Merchant Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.

String.Source: Stop the Mod From Giving You Another Pill After Using or Discarding it
String.Dest: Stop the Mod From Giving You Another Pill After Using or Discarding it

String.Source: Increase or Decrease How Much the Player Can Carry
String.Dest: Increase or Decrease How Much the Player Can Carry

String.Source: Chance of Treasure Hunter Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.
String.Dest: Chance of Treasure Hunter Appearing in Dungeon. Higher number means more likely.

String.Source: Percentage of FXUndead Speed to Reduce. Choosing .90 Will Produce Very Slow Undead. If you use .10 The Undead Will Be Very Fast.
String.Dest: Percentage of FXUndead Speed to Reduce. Choosing .90 Will Produce Very Slow Undead. If you use .10 The Undead Will Be Very Fast.

String.Source: Decrease Speed The Speed of FxUndead by the Slider Amount Below.
String.Dest: Decrease Speed The Speed of FxUndead by the Slider Amount Below.

String.Source: Add a 50% Chance of A FxUndead Being Spawned at 25% of Players Level. Normal is Equal to Players Level.
String.Dest: Add a 50% Chance of A FxUndead Being Spawned at 25% of Players Level. Normal is Equal to Players Level.

String.Source: Number of Attackers that will form the mob in a surface encounter. From 0 to 16 in increments of 4.
String.Dest: Number of Attackers that will form the mob in a surface encounter. From 0 to 16 in increments of 4.

String.Source: Increases Likelihood of Silver Hands Appearing by Adding This Value to The Die Rolls. Higher Makes it More Likely.
String.Dest: Increases Likelihood of Silver Hands Appearing by Adding This Value to The Die Rolls. Higher Makes it More Likely.

String.Source: Maximum Number of Added Spawns Added Per Battle
String.Dest: Maximum Number of Added Spawns Added Per Battle

String.Source: Die roll 1 of 2 That Determines if Player is Ambushed While Exploring Dungeon. Zero = No Chance. Odds are set initially the same as Walking Encounters
String.Dest: Die roll 1 of 2 That Determines if Player is Ambushed While Exploring Dungeon. Zero = No Chance. Odds are set initially the same as Walking Encounters

String.Source: Die roll 2 of 2 That Determines if Player is Ambushed While Exploring Dungeon. Zero = No Chance. Odds are set initially the same as Walking Encounters
String.Dest: Die roll 2 of 2 That Determines if Player is Ambushed While Exploring Dungeon. Zero = No Chance. Odds are set initially the same as Walking Encounters

String.Source: Disable Spirits if Necessary. Spirits are Normally Invisible and Used as Spawning Points in Dungeon Encounters.
String.Dest: Disable Spirits if Necessary. Spirits are Normally Invisible and Used as Spawning Points in Dungeon Encounters.

String.Source: Odds Of a Sick Rat Appearing. 100 is always. This is Checked Two to Three Times a Minute So Keep It Low.
String.Dest: Odds Of a Sick Rat Appearing. 100 is always. This is Checked Two to Three Times a Minute So Keep It Low.

String.Source: Odds Of a Healthy Rat Appearing. 100 is always. This is Checked Two to Three Times a Minute So Keep It Low.
String.Dest: Odds Of a Healthy Rat Appearing. 100 is always. This is Checked Two to Three Times a Minute So Keep It Low.

String.Source: Whether Rats Are Allowed in Dungeons. This Includes Normal Rats and Sick Rats.
String.Dest: Whether Rats Are Allowed in Dungeons. This Includes Normal Rats and Sick Rats.

String.Source: If Activated the Cooldown Between Increased Spawns will be Repeatedly Randomly Chosen Between 1 and the Spawn Cooldown Number Chosen With Slider.
String.Dest: If Activated the Cooldown Between Increased Spawns will be Repeatedly Randomly Chosen Between 1 and the Spawn Cooldown Number Chosen With Slider.

String.Source: Increase the number for a higher chance of an attack while Fast Travelling. Reduce the number to lessen it. Range is 0 to 100.
String.Dest: Increase the number for a higher chance of an attack while Fast Travelling. Reduce the number to lessen it. Range is 0 to 100.

String.Source: Toggle whether Fast Travel Encounters in the Wild are allowed. Normally 50% of battles are at the town gates, the other half are in the wild.
String.Dest: Toggle whether Fast Travel Encounters in the Wild are allowed. Normally 50% of battles are at the town gates, the other half are in the wild.

String.Source: If Toggled On It Will Allow Blight NPCs to Take Damage From Any Attack, Not Just Fire.
String.Dest: If Toggled On It Will Allow Blight NPCs to Take Damage From Any Attack, Not Just Fire.

String.Source: If Toggled On There Will Only Be Walking Encounters at Night.
String.Dest: If Toggled On There Will Only Be Walking Encounters at Night.

String.Source: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Bane Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.
String.Dest: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Bane Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.

String.Source: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Bane the Werewolf Hunter to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown
String.Dest: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Bane the Werewolf Hunter to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown

String.Source: Base Cooldown Period Between Walking Encounters. Initially set to 15. Calculated at this number times the script timer, in seconds. See Help Scroll 3 for more info.
String.Dest: Base Cooldown Period Between Walking Encounters. Initially set to 15. Calculated at this number times the script timer, in seconds. See Help Scroll 3 for more info.

String.Source: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Blade the Vampire Hunter to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown
String.Dest: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Blade the Vampire Hunter to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown

String.Source: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Burning Inferno to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown
String.Dest: Select the Number of Days Before It is Possible for Burning Inferno to Appear. Picking Zero Disables Cooldown

String.Source: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Blade Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.
String.Dest: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Blade Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.

String.Source: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Inferno Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.
String.Dest: If Enabled Will Set Cooldown Period Between 1 and the Number Selected With Slider. After Inferno Appears a New Random Cooldown is Chosen.

String.Source: If Increased Spawns Style Above is Set to TACTICAL, Determines at What Enemy Detection Level Increased Spawns Are Allowed, With Zero Being Always Allowed/Constant. Level 1 Means Player Has Been Hit 1 to 3 Times, Level 2 is 4 to 6 Times, Level 3 is 7 Times or More.
String.Dest: If Increased Spawns Style Above is Set to TACTICAL, Determines at What Enemy Detection Level Increased Spawns Are Allowed, With Zero Being Always Allowed/Constant. Level 1 Means Player Has Been Hit 1 to 3 Times, Level 2 is 4 to 6 Times, Level 3 is 7 Times or More.

String.Source: Measure script latency as you play and display notification every few seconds. Ideally latency should stay around 50 ms and never go above 100 ms. Wrong results caused by menu mode should be ignored. Courtesy of Alex from Convenient Horses aka mitchalek.
String.Dest: Measure script latency as you play and display notification every few seconds. Ideally latency should stay around 50 ms and never go above 100 ms. Wrong results caused by menu mode should be ignored. Courtesy of Alex from Convenient Horses aka mitchalek.

String.Source: Extend The Time That All Scripts Fire. From 0 to 180 seconds. The Higher The Less Strain on Game But Less Efficient and Accurate. Will Also Affect The Odds Already Set.
String.Dest: Extend The Time That All Scripts Fire. From 0 to 180 seconds. The Higher The Less Strain on Game But Less Efficient and Accurate. Will Also Affect The Odds Already Set.

String.Source: Will mark a small room or sleeping area as encounter free when sleeping. Useful for a custom player home. 6 Safe Locations are provided. Please select any of the 6 to set this location as safe.
String.Dest: Will mark a small room or sleeping area as encounter free when sleeping. Useful for a custom player home. 6 Safe Locations are provided. Please select any of the 6 to set this location as safe.

String.Source: When the player wakes up, and if laying on bed animations are not enabled, the player will be drowsy and sluggish to respond for a second.
String.Dest: When the player wakes up, and if laying on bed animations are not enabled, the player will be drowsy and sluggish to respond for a second.

String.Source: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In All Other Places.
String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In All Other Places.

String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In a Draugr Keep.

String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In a Inn.

String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In Jorrvaskr HQ.

String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In the Mages College.

String.Dest: Set The Odds From 0 to 100 for Getting Ambushed While Sleeping In a Dungeon.

String.Source: Disables or Enables the Punishment for Killing Refugees
String.Dest: Disables or Enables the Punishment for Killing Refugees

String.Source: Disables or Enables the use of non vanilla armors and weapons.
String.Dest: Disables or Enables the use of non vanilla armors and weapons.

String.Source: Toggle whether there is a chance of trapped Treasures Chests being left behind.
String.Dest: Toggle whether there is a chance of trapped Treasures Chests being left behind.

String.Source: Will enable or disable notification messages when enemies are spawned.
String.Dest: Will enable or disable notification messages when enemies are spawned.

String.Source: If Enabled will block most non lore features. If Disabled will allow Young People, Silver Hands, Blade, Bane, Burning Inferno, Treasure Chests, etc.
String.Dest: If Enabled will block most non lore features. If Disabled will allow Young People, Silver Hands, Blade, Bane, Burning Inferno, Treasure Chests, etc.

String.Source: Controls Fast Travel Ambushes. Only Fires One Time per Fast Travel.
String.Dest: Controls Fast Travel Ambushes. Only Fires One Time per Fast Travel.

String.Source: Controls SLeeping Ambushes. Only Fires One Time per Sleep Session.
String.Dest: Controls SLeeping Ambushes. Only Fires One Time per Sleep Session.

String.Source: Make the Silver Hands more Lore Friendly
String.Dest: Make the Silver Hands more Lore Friendly

String.Source: Allow Silver Hand Werewolf Hunters, Including Blade
String.Dest: Allow Silver Hand Werewolf Hunters, Including Blade

String.Source: Make the hunters more lore friendly. No new armor or weapons.
String.Dest: Make the hunters more lore friendly. No new armor or weapons.

String.Source: Whether or not to Allow Vampire Hunters to Spawn. Will hunt Vampire players and Includes Master Hunter Blade
String.Dest: Whether or not to Allow Vampire Hunters to Spawn. Will hunt Vampire players and Includes Master Hunter Blade

String.Source: Aids in Fast Travel Detection, a Secondary Script
String.Dest: Aids in Fast Travel Detection, a Secondary Script

String.Source: Handles Mod ACtivation and Deactivation from MCM Menu. Also Silver Weapons Effects.
String.Dest: Handles Mod ACtivation and Deactivation from MCM Menu. Also Silver Weapons Effects.

String.Source: Drives the Sleeping Animations. This should be first thing disabled to save resources.
String.Dest: Drives the Sleeping Animations. This should be first thing disabled to save resources.

String.Source: Burning Inferno Script is responsible for several Inferno features as well as Stopping/Starting Innocents Quest.
String.Dest: Burning Inferno Script is responsible for several Inferno features as well as Stopping/Starting Innocents Quest.

String.Source: Waiting Encounters Script Controls Dungeon Encounters Including Increased Spawns.
String.Dest: Waiting Encounters Script Controls Dungeon Encounters Including Increased Spawns.

String.Source: Walking Encounters Script is the hardest working script in SOT. Controls surface encounters including Increased Spawns.
String.Dest: Walking Encounters Script is the hardest working script in SOT. Controls surface encounters including Increased Spawns.

String.Source: Revenge Mode : Toggles whether she will avenge the death of Blade or Bane.
String.Dest: Revenge Mode : Toggles whether she will avenge the death of Blade or Bane.

String.Source: Enable or Disable the Shield That Often Protects Burning Inferno.
String.Dest: Enable or Disable the Shield That Often Protects Burning Inferno.

String.Source: Select Between Full Power Burning Inferno or Weaker Fire Girl. Fire Girl Has no Demon Larvae, Shield, or Earth Spell.
String.Dest: Select Between Full Power Burning Inferno or Weaker Fire Girl. Fire Girl Has no Demon Larvae, Shield, or Earth Spell.

String.Source: Will Enable or Disable Burning Inferno.
String.Dest: Will Enable or Disable Burning Inferno.

String.Source: Set Player Level at Which Hard Spawn Are Allowed. NPCs will be less, 66% slower, and have greatly reduced hitpoints.
String.Dest: Set Player Level at Which Hard Spawn Are Allowed. NPCs will be less, 66% slower, and have greatly reduced hitpoints.

String.Source: Whether Chance of Cloning is Tactical/Constant or Based on odds of Encounters Just Like Waiting in a Dungeon. See Extended Help Scroll 1.
String.Dest: Whether Chance of Cloning is Tactical/Constant or Based on odds of Encounters Just Like Waiting in a Dungeon. See Extended Help Scroll 1.

String.Source: Maximum Number of Spawns, from 1 to 5. A random number in the specified range will be chosen .
String.Dest: Maximum Number of Spawns, from 1 to 5. A random number in the specified range will be chosen .

String.Source: Enable or Disable Increased Dungeon Spawns. Surface Increased Spawns are not Affected.
String.Dest: Enable or Disable Increased Dungeon Spawns. Surface Increased Spawns are not Affected.

String.Source: Increase the number for a higher chance of an attack while Waiting in a Dungeon. Reduce the number to lessen it. Range is 0 to 100.
String.Dest: Increase the number for a higher chance of an attack while Waiting in a Dungeon. Reduce the number to lessen it. Range is 0 to 100.

String.Source: For testing only. Will enable a stream of notifications for diagnosing and verification. Run when mod is working fine so you know the baseline for your system.
String.Dest: For testing only. Will enable a stream of notifications for diagnosing and verification. Run when mod is working fine so you know the baseline for your system.

String.Source: How Much Time Between Increased Spawn Attempts. Multiply the Timer Number by This Mumber to Equal Seconds in Between Spawn Attempts.
String.Dest: How Much Time Between Increased Spawn Attempts. Multiply the Timer Number by This Mumber to Equal Seconds in Between Spawn Attempts.

String.Source: Enable or Disable Cloning of Dragons by Increased Spawns Feature.
String.Dest: Enable or Disable Cloning of Dragons by Increased Spawns Feature.

String.Source: Enable or Disable Increased Spawns While Walking on the Surface.
String.Dest: Enable or Disable Increased Spawns While Walking on the Surface.

String.Source: Enable or Disable Increased Surface Spawns From Any Source Choose Maximum Number of Spawns, from 1 to 5. A random amount in the specified range will be chosen .
String.Dest: Enable or Disable Increased Surface Spawns From Any Source Choose Maximum Number of Spawns, from 1 to 5. A random amount in the specified range will be chosen .

String.Source: Choose a number from 0 to 120. This will be the minimum number of minutes between encounters while walking on the surface. See Help Scroll 3 for more info.
String.Dest: Choose a number from 0 to 120. This will be the minimum number of minutes between encounters while walking on the surface. See Help Scroll 3 for more info.

String.Source: Controls how often the main Walking Encounter Scripts fires. Default is every 20 seconds. Can be increased to 90 seconds, and decreased all the way down to 13. May help with resource issues and crashes.
String.Dest: Controls how often the main Walking Encounter Scripts fires. Default is every 20 seconds. Can be increased to 90 seconds, and decreased all the way down to 13. May help with resource issues and crashes.

String.Source: Likelihood of Not Having an Encounter in the Day Time Hours, Expressed as a Percentage Versus Present Die Roll Settings.
String.Dest: Likelihood of Not Having an Encounter in the Day Time Hours, Expressed as a Percentage Versus Present Die Roll Settings.

String.Source: Odds of having an encounter while Walking are determined by TWO dice rolls every X seconds. Increase each to INCREASE encounters. Lower value to LOWER walking encounters.
String.Dest: Odds of having an encounter while Walking are determined by TWO dice rolls every X seconds. Increase each to INCREASE encounters. Lower value to LOWER walking encounters.

String.Source: Toggle to Activate Mod. Then exit menu and wait 4 minutes for full activation. Save Game. Default: false
String.Dest: Toggle to Activate Mod. Then exit menu and wait 4 minutes for full activation. Save Game. Default: false

String.Source: Controls the Encounters While Walking On the Surface.
String.Dest: Controls the Encounters While Walking On the Surface.

String.Source: Controls the Encounters While Using Fast Travel.
String.Dest: Controls the Encounters While Using Fast Travel.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From Walking on the Surface.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From Walking on the Surface.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From Using Fast Travel.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From Using Fast Travel.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From Waiting in a Dungeon.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From Waiting in a Dungeon.

String.Source: Pauses Encounters While Using Fast Travel.
String.Dest: Pauses Encounters While Using Fast Travel.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From Traditional Surface Spawns.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From Traditional Surface Spawns.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From Mephala Assassins.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From Mephala Assassins.

String.Source: Pauses the Encounters From the ''Bulwark'' Engine Which Bolsters Vanilla Spawns.
String.Dest: Pauses the Encounters From the ''Bulwark'' Engine Which Bolsters Vanilla Spawns.

String.Source: Recommended For a Very Light Challenge. No Populated Dungeons, Minimal Spawns. Like all Milk Drinkers.
String.Dest: Recommended For a Very Light Challenge. No Populated Dungeons, Minimal Spawns. Like all Milk Drinkers.

String.Source: Recommended For a Casual Challenge. Has Almost Zero SOT Populated Dungeons, Minimal Spawns. No Genesis. For All Adventurers.
String.Dest: Recommended For a Casual Challenge. Has Almost Zero SOT Populated Dungeons, Minimal Spawns. No Genesis. For All Adventurers.

String.Source: The Recommended option. Challenge For A Real Spartan Without Spamming Spawns. FOR SPARTA!!!
String.Dest: The Recommended option. Challenge For A Real Spartan Without Spamming Spawns. FOR SPARTA!!!

String.Source: Serious Challenge For Players With Over Powered Groups Needing Extra Spawns And Dangers.
String.Dest: Serious Challenge For Players With Over Powered Groups Needing Extra Spawns And Dangers.

String.Source: Ridiculously Hard Settings. Spawns Will Be Constant And Many. Living Will Be A Constant Nightmare. Not Truly A Playable Setting.
String.Dest: Ridiculously Hard Settings. Spawns Will Be Constant And Many. Living Will Be A Constant Nightmare. Not Truly A Playable Setting.

String.Source: FISS Mod Required To Save To Or Load From SoTSave Files. See The Sands Of Time Nexus Page For More Info.
String.Dest: FISS Mod Required To Save To Or Load From SoTSave Files. See The Sands Of Time Nexus Page For More Info.

String.Source: FISS Mod Installed Saving To And Loading From SoTSave Files Is Enabled.
String.Dest: FISS Mod Installed Saving To And Loading From SoTSave Files Is Enabled.

String.Source: SoTSave Files Are Found In The Following Directory ''Data\SKSE\Plugins\FISS\Sands Of Time''
String.Dest: SoTSave Files Are Found In The Following Directory ''Data\SKSE\Plugins\FISS\Sands Of Time''

String.Source: SoT Settings Will Be Saved To And Overwrite The SoTSave File Chosen Above. Two Confirmation Boxes Will Appear.
String.Dest: SoT Settings Will Be Saved To And Overwrite The SoTSave File Chosen Above. Two Confirmation Boxes Will Appear.

String.Source: SoT Settings Will Be Loaded And Overwritten From The SoTSave File Chosen Above. Two Confirmation Boxes Will Appear.
String.Dest: SoT Settings Will Be Loaded And Overwritten From The SoTSave File Chosen Above. Two Confirmation Boxes Will Appear.

String.Source: Wether to Allow Chameleon Master Assassins and Lesser Chamele on Thugs.
String.Dest: Wether to Allow Chameleon Master Assassins and Lesser Chamele on Thugs.
